data.title: Former Fiji PM jailed for corruption
data.meta_description: Hopes for democracy in Fiji suffered another blow yesterday as Laisenia Qarase, the country’s last democratically elected Prime Minister, was jailed for a year over corruption charges.  The sentence
data.text:
Hopes for democracy in Fiji suffered another blow yesterday as Laisenia Qarase, the country’s last democratically elected Prime Minister, was jailed for a year over corruption charges.

The sentence disqualifies Mr Qarase, the 71-year-old leader of the United Fiji Party (SDL), from campaigning in Fiji’s 2014 elections, in which he is a leading contender.

Mr Qarase, who became Prime Minister in 2000 and was ousted in a military coup six years later, was sentenced amid tight security by Justice Priyantha Fernando at the High Court in Suva. He was convicted after a long running corruption trial on nine charges of abuse of office and failing to discharge his duty, in a case brought by Fiji’s anti-corruption watchdog
